body.p: This version of the TEI introduces new features and resolves a number of issues raised by the TEI community. As always, the majority of these changes and corrections are a consequence of feature requests or bugs reported by the TEI community, using the SourceForge tracking system. If you find something you think needs to change in the TEI Guidelines, schemas, tools, or website, please submit a feature request or bug ticket at http://tei.sf.net/ for consideration.

Some of the highlights of the TEI P5 2.4.0 release include:
A new simplified index/table-of-contents page for the web version of the Guidelines.
Hundreds of typos fixed, prose made clearer, and formatting issues solved
Element sex and attributes value and sex changed to allow more inclusive values (per FR 425)
Usage of app with no lem or just note explained and illustrated (per BUG 366)
A number of changes to loosen content models, mostly driven by experience of TCP EEBO project:
allow a teiCorpus to have facsimile and sourceDoc children, like TEI (FR 456)
loosen content model of cell to make it the same as p (FR 455)
expand content model of figure to allow more components (FR 454)
allow foreign to contain q (FR 442)
allow epigraph at end of front (FR 434)
Implementation of a new notation for deprecated elements and attributes, which now have a valid until date recorded
Since the last P5 release, several releases have also been made to the family of XSL stylesheets maintained for the TEI, largely fixing bugs in conversion to ePub, and to/from Word docx format.

A new translation of the TEI Lite tutorial into French has been completed, and is now included in the Exemplars directory. The French translations for a number of element descriptions were corrected at the same time. Unlike earlier versions, this version of the TEI Lite tutorial now uses only French language examples.
